channel.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
channel.description:
Who would play such a game?
There are some caveats that I can think of which might be hard/impossible to correct: 1. Walking - there would no longer be 'chasing' as you have when pking in RSC. 2. Actions, such as talking to NPCs, wouldn't really block others from using the NPC. I suppose you could change this, but would you want to?
I can't think of any other stuff right now. What are your thoughts? Do any other issues/caveats come to mind?

item.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Somewhat off-topic:

My understanding is that his involvement in DDoS attacks is historical, not current.

When I was an admin I received a lot of tit for tat story telling from numerous parties.
The short version is that programming work was performed, paid for, and then that payment reversed. I don’t know why the payment was revoked. Anyway, this is why Moparisthebest has always disallowed quid pro quo arrangements. It’s too easy for somebody to get burned, and it leads to feuds like this one.

[font=verdana]Frankly I don’t doubt for a second that there are numerous guilty parties here. The problem is that any evidence has been either unconvincing or potentially falsified. So really, there are probably some people on this website who have avoided banning during my time as an administrator simply because they were clever enough to keep their mouth shut about those activities.[/font]

Read full topic

item.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:53, topic:548221”][quote author=PKWith.Me link=topic=667127.msg4461631#msg4461631 date=1417823156]

Unfortunately Tx has been banned because he takes part in DDoS attacks on other servers, among other things.

95% of RSC people have participated in such things.
[/quote]
Perhaps the number is more closely at 1% because most of us do not stoop to those levels of immaturity. Fullscreen support has existed in previous clients.

Potential clients to refactor:
https://github.com/xetr0v/mpc-client
https://github.com/CodeForFame/Client
https://github.com/projectrsc/ProjectRSC/tree/master/ProjectRSC/Client
https://www.assembla.com/code/darkquest/subversion/nodes/80/DarkQuest%20Client
https://github.com/Marwolf/Wolf-Kingdom/tree/master/Client[/quote]

If you can tell me which of those is the “best”, and help me get it up and running on a local server, I’ll take a look

Read full topic

item.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:53, topic:548221”][quote author=PKWith.Me link=topic=667127.msg4461631#msg4461631 date=1417823156]

Unfortunately Tx has been banned because he takes part in DDoS attacks on other servers, among other things.

95% of RSC people have participated in such things.
[/quote]
Perhaps the number is more closely at 1% because most of us do not stoop to those levels of immaturity. Fullscreen support has existed in previous clients.

Potential clients to refactor:
https://github.com/xetr0v/mpc-client
https://github.com/CodeForFame/Client
https://github.com/projectrsc/ProjectRSC/tree/master/ProjectRSC/Client
https://www.assembla.com/code/darkquest/subversion/nodes/80/DarkQuest%20Client
https://github.com/Marwolf/Wolf-Kingdom/tree/master/Client[/quote]
Are any of those unsullied though? And are they all the same version and protocol?

The problem with listing five clients like that is it’s unclear which ones have features added. It’s also unclear how robust those features are.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Ambokile:

What are RSC clients like refactor wise? I’ve never looked into them but I’d love to refactor one as a project.

Pretty well done, actually. Someone here should be able to link you to one of the better ones.

[quote=“PKWith.Me, post:6, topic:548257”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=667127.msg4461629#msg4461629 date=1417821370]
Unfortunately Tx has been banned because he takes part in DDoS attacks on other servers, among other things.
[/quote]
95% of RSC people have participated in such things. [/quote]
And they’re all clever enough not to get caught.

Either way, congratulations to those who take part in that activity - you’ve left the player community in shambles.

EDIT: By the way, what did it take to make the RSC client fullscreen like that?

Read full topic

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think Toothless is a pretty cool dragon. Eh fights much bigger dragons and doesn’t afraid of anything.

Are the models really that big a deal? I’ll be honest, I’ve never been so worried about aesthetics myself.

Read full topic
item.source: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server

item.title: RSC mechanics in an RS2 client/server
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“vortex, post:45, topic:548221”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=667127.msg4461534#msg4461534 date=1417771209]
RS2 did extend past the really early revisions you know… huge difference between models and sprites

Models like this weren’t that late into RS2

[/quote]can older clients like the one Ambokile posted use these higher detail models? if not, are any of the newer clients refactored and/or understood as well as the 317 client?[/quote]

Yes, they can. It’s entirely feasible to simply make the client read a different/newer cache so you can simply drag and drop.

This is often done with older clients (revision #194 for example) where the caches are incomplete and so newer caches are used.

Read full topic
